37c7234e9d796737cda22f5a4dc3df5b85cef531.description:

20c00517dd564669fc026f31b1fecc21dbe1db21.title: Stanford’s Pulitzer Winner Jack Rakove on American Independence
20c00517dd564669fc026f31b1fecc21dbe1db21.description:
In this week’s episode of The Learning Curve, co-hosts Alisha Searcy and Massachusetts civics teacher Kelley Brown interview Pulitzer Prize-winning historian Jack Rakove, Coe Professor Emeritus at Stanford University. Prof. Rakove explores the origins of the American Revolution and U.S. Constitution through the lives of the nation’s Founding Era figures. Reflecting on young John Adams’ vivid depiction of his schoolhouse in colonial Massachusetts, Rakove offers context for the political and social landscape of the 18th-century America.

The post Stanford’s Pulitzer Winner Jack Rakove on American Independence appeared first on Pioneer Institute.

9b31969d1b902df8f3a559e5da0ba6b586b10920.description:
Iowa’s reliance on federal funds flowing through our state—which cumulatively exceed the $9.4 billion state General Fund—reveals a growing imbalance that puts Iowa at risk. With Congress considering ways to rein in federal deficits by cutting spending on programs like Medicaid or food assistance (SNAP), Iowa’s General Fund might be forced to make up the difference. This would give Iowa taxpayers serious pain.

95b5efe8383a08071bde2fef2271171f2b64c9f7.title: NYT Bestseller Jane Leavy on Reforming Major League Baseball
95b5efe8383a08071bde2fef2271171f2b64c9f7.description:
In this week’s episode of The Learning Curve, co-hosts U-Arkansas Prof. Albert Cheng and Pioneer Senior Fellow Charlie Chieppo interview award-winning journalist and New York Times bestselling author Jane Leavy. Ms. Leavy discusses her lifelong love of baseball, and her forthcoming book, Make Me Commissioner: I Know What’s Wrong with Baseball and How to Fix It, which comes out in September.

The post NYT Bestseller Jane Leavy on Reforming Major League Baseball appeared first on Pioneer Institute.

9f05d0b104f9da8f0e082e987402cafd7bf68b50.title: Gov. Reynolds channels the conviction of Margaret Thatcher
9f05d0b104f9da8f0e082e987402cafd7bf68b50.description:
“One of the great debates of our time is about how much of your money should be spent by the State and how much you should keep to spend on your family. Let us never forget this fundamental truth: the State has no source of money other than money which people earn themselves. If the State wishes to spend more it can do so only by borrowing your savings or by taxing you more. It is no good thinking that someone else will pay – that 'someone else' is you. There is no such thing as public money; there is only taxpayers' money,” stated Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher.

The post Gov. Reynolds channels the conviction of Margaret Thatcher appeared first on ITR Foundation.

231a4983daaf4b734e44b3c323e5fea872eafe90.title: Center Cosigns Letter Supporting Seafreeze Petition to Suspend VINEYARD WIND Construction
231a4983daaf4b734e44b3c323e5fea872eafe90.description:
Today, CEO for the Rhode Island Center for Freedom & Prosperity, Mike Stenhouse, co-signed a letter, along with national energy expert, G. Allen Brooks, requesting Doug Brugum, Secretary of the US Department Of the Interior (DOI), and other federal officials to accept the formal petition previously filed Seafreeze Inc (and others) that calls upon the government to immediately suspend "further construction and energy generation activity" of the near-completed Vineyard Wind off-shore wind project.

The post Center Cosigns Letter Supporting Seafreeze Petition to Suspend VINEYARD WIND Construction appeared first on RI Center for Freedom and Prosperity.
